intro: Elymus × magadanensis, commonly known as the Siberian wheatgrass, is a hybrid grass species native to the cold climates of eastern Siberia and northern China. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of hair. This plant is well adapted to harsh environments, thriving in well-drained soils and exhibiting frost resistance. It produces dense, spike-like inflorescences that bear small, wind-pollinated flowers. Elymus × magadanensis is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and prevent erosion in arid and semi-arid regions.
